[42]If this is some sort of practical-I mean -my fucking blood pressure is going through the roof right now. 
[43]It doesn't fucking matter what you thought. It matters what you did. It matters what you didn't do. If all this shit is true I made a fucking ass of myself at Thompson's place. And I gave away our game plan. 
[44]Let me think...let me think... 
[45]We get the Governor right after he finishes singing Kum Bay Ya and give him everything we know. 
[46]You, me and the Governor, that's it! What's he got after? 
[47]He'll be late...we're gonna tell him that if he doesn't offer Thompson a cabinet position...he's not gonna get the nomination. 
[48]I don't fucking know Stephen. 
[49]Find us a room... 
[50]Who the fuck knows Governor...but we can't take the chance... 
[51]I think we fold up the campaign in Ohio...take a loss and blame it on the Republican's playing games...head to North Carolina. 
[52]Not if you get Thompson's endorsement. 
[53]Governor, if you lose Ohio, and they get Thompson's delegates...Then they get North Carolina...then they get the lead. A lead you can't beat. But if we walk from Ohio, take Thompson, give him a cabinet post, then we take North Carolina. His state. Then Pennsylvania. Your state. And then it's simple math Mike. Take his endorsement and the race is over. 
[54]No, No that's not what I'm saying...we were the underdog before we got into this and we continue to be the underdog...well the numbers...we knew the numbers would get closer the closer we got to Tuesday...I'm not lowering expectations...have you ever heard me say that we had Ohio locked?... Then at least give me the courtesy of printing that in your column. 
[55]Keep an eye on the Governor. 
[56]Absolutely -there's no question about it .... 
[57]But we've got to think broader strokes here, rethink everything....uh-huh....Yeah, I know how to handle it....Look,Stevie just got here. Can I call you back in a few minutes? ..Okay, bye. The Governor. We had a good long talk on the way back. He's up to speed with everything. 
[58]Better than I thought he would. Still won't take Thompson's endorsement. 
[59]What's up? 
[60]So it's gonna hit the papers. 
[61]I leaked it to Ida. 
[62]At the event. 
[63]We made a deal. 
[64]I know. 
[65]The campaign will survive. 
[66]Makes it easier to let you go. 
[67]Why'd you meet with Duffy? 
[68]No Stephen. You didn't make a mistake. You made a choice. You called me and left a message to call back...that it was important. But when I did...you said to forget about it. You chose not to tell me. Why did you make that choice? 
[69]Sure you did. But you went because you were curious, because you were flattered. Because it made you feel special to think Duffy wanted to speak to you instead of me. Because you thought to yourself: maybe I can get something out of this. Because it made you feel big. First campaign I ran tiny little race in Kentucky -state senate seat. Workin for redneck nobody named McGuthrie. Had no money, no staff, no fuckin office. Everyone thought we didn't stand a chance. There's no way we can compete. And about this time, a guy running a congressional campaign a few districts over gives me a call. Says, "I really like what you were able to do for poor ole' Sam. But let's face it, he's a goner, so why don't you come work for me?" What do I do? Well Stephen -this is where you and I are different. I told Sam about the call. And Sam says to me, "Paul, you think this other's guy's got a shot at winning, and he can pay you more than anything I can afford, so if it's what you feel you need to do, then I won't get in your way." So I say, "Sam -you took a chance and hired me when I was even more of nobody than you are, and I'd be damned if I'm gonna jump ship just because the shit hit the fan." We lost the race, but three years later, when Sam decided to run for Governor -who do you think he called? We won that race. 74. 
[70]And twenty years later I'm where I am now.  There's only one thing I value in this world Steve, and that's loyalty. Without it you're nothing and you have no one. And in politics it's the only currency that you can count on. That's why I'm letting you go. Not because you're not good enough. But I value trust over skill. And I don't trust you anymore. 
[71]The Governor knows, he thinks it's the right thing to do. 
[72]If I were you? I'd get a good night sleep because you're gonna get fucking pounded by calls from the press in the morning... 
[73]She'd only been on the road with us for a few weeks...maybe four I think, I can check. 
[74]We will most certainly stay on schedule. This accident, and we have to assume for now it's an accident, is just simply a tragedy. The work, the schedule won't be altered. It just means that those of us that knew Molly will go about our jobs with a heavy heart. 
[75]The Governor and I both felt, that in light of some of these changing numbers, it was best to put a new face on the campaign...Stephen is very talented...very smart... 
[76]You should hire Jack for a speech writer. 
[77]No. I'm friends with the family. I got her the internship...known her since she was born. 
[78]The Governor couldn't make the flight? 
[79]Look at you, all grown up with tits and all. 
[80]One day we'll grab a beer and you'll tell me what you had on the Governor that put me out. 
[81]You better get going, you've got a campaign to run and I've got offices to go look at. 
[82]Nice consultant firm right off of K Street. 
[83]A million a year and nobody to fuck you over. 94. 
[84]Doesn't it.
dialogues.DUFFY:
[1]I'm trying to remember if the democrats ever nominated an atheist before... 
[2]Must've been you that did the prep work. Paul's not that clever. 
[3]Looks like you got some brains now too. Be careful. I just might have to steal him from you. 
[4]Hey Stephen... 24. 
[5]Tom Duffy...sorry about the dad bit...but I didn't think you'd want my name yelled out at a Morris campaign office. 
[6]You got a couple of minutes...I'd like to sit down with you. 
[7]I think it's important. 
[8]I'm calling you...This is all on the up and up...just give me five minutes. 
[9]I hear you...but if you get five minutes...I'll be at the Heads First Sports Bar for the next couple of hours. 
[10]There won't be anybody there...if you get a chance there's something I want to show you. 25. 
[11]You're working for the wrong man. 
[12]Oh on the contrary you are working for the wrong man. You've got something the other guys don't have. 
[13]Yeah, what is it exactly? Charm isn't the right word. It's more than that. You exude something. You draw people in. All the reporters love you. Even the ones that hate you love you. You play them all like they're pieces on a chess board. And you make it look effortless. We both know how much work it takes, constantly being on guard, weighing every word so carefully, every move. But from the outside, you make it look easy. 26. 
[14]People are scared of you because they don't understand how you do it, and they love you for it. There's nothing more valuable in this business - the ability to win people's respect by making them mistake their fear for love. You can guess what I'm gonna say next. 
[15]I want you to work for us. 
[16]Not in the least. You are going to lose Ohio. 
[17]You're sitting on about a six percent lead in both polls...six percent of the Democrats polled. 
[18]Six...but that doesn't matter...Independents and Republicans can vote for the Democratic candidate. 
[19]Fuck no they hate him...they think they can beat my guy...but they're worried about yours...so starting tomorrow morning you're gonna see a fucking blitz...Rush Limbaugh, Sean Hannity, all the right wing blogs are gonna start a "Get out the vote campaign"...it's already started...every fucking conservative in Ohio is gonna stand in line and punch my guys ticket...that's just one of the steps...Ohio is gone...the polls don't mean shit...tomorrow morning everyone will know...that's why I want you to handle the fallout we'll take in the press... 
[20]And by the way...we've got Thompson in the bag. 
[21]We promised him Secretary of State, Ohio is over...it's been over for weeks...and with Thompson's delegates...I'm thinking down the road now...that's why I want you...I'll bring you in straight at the top. 
[22]I'm not asking for an answer right this moment. 
[23]None of this is about the democratic process Steve, It's about getting your guy into office. Simple as that. 
[24]You're right, this is exactly what the Republicans do, and it's about time we learned from them. They're meaner, tougher and more disciplined than we are. I've been in this business for twenty five years and I've seen way too many Democrats bite the dust because they wouldn't get down in the mud with the fucking elephants. 
[25]Do you want to work for a friend or do you want to work for the President? Think about it...you have my number. 
[26]Is it decisive?...Of Course not...look, we believe that the polls are within the margin of error and that the Senator will win Ohio...with Ohio Democrats...I can't really see Republicans showing up to vote for our candidate...having said that, we'll take all the support we can get. 
[27]Excuse me? 
[28]Leaked what? 
[29]Bullshit you...I have no idea what you're talking about. 
[30]Yeah? 
[31]What fucking story? 
[32]How did she find out? 65. 
[33]You think I leaked it to her? 
[34]I didn't leak it to her. 
[35]What's she know? 
[36]I swear to Jesus I didn't leak it to her Steve. I don't want this story out any more than you do. 
[37]What did she tell you? 
[38]She has a source? 
[39]And you have no idea who it could be? 
[40]Well it wasn't me, and for the record I didn't have fucking buffalo wings. It's gotta be some one else. 
[41]No. Did you? 
[42]Did you admit to meeting with me? 
[43]Then we stonewall her and she's got nothing. 
[44]You can't stop her? 
[45]Then tell her what she wants to know. 
[46]You can't let this story get out. 
[47]You don't have much of a choice here. 67. 
[48]Then tell her. I can handle it from my side if I start getting calls. 
[49]You're gonna look like fools anyway when he endorses us. 
[50]You're on a sinking ship Steve. Tell her what she wants to know and jump. Come over to our side. We can control this thing. 
[51]Steve? 
[52]Joe can you excuse us for a minute. 78. 
[53]Not very bright, walking in here... 
[54]A reporter at Roll Call phoned me this afternoon. 
[55]Who? 
[56]You told Paul? 
[57]You shouldn't have told him that. 
[58]I've worked with Paul. He gets paranoid. 
[59]So he fired you. 
[60]You're lying to me...come on... 
[61]I already know his strategy. Paul gave it all to Thompson. 
[62]You'd do that to Morris? To Paul? 
[63]Revenge makes people unpredictable Steve. I can't have someone who's unpredictable. Who's unstable. 
[64]If it had been a clean break -if you'd left Morris before this story broke, that'd be one thing. That we could control. But the way it'd look now -Paul fires you and then you come work for us. Looks like we're picking up the scraps. Puts Morris in the drivers seat. I can't have that. 
[65]Like what? 
[66]What is it? 80. 
[67]It's not gonna happen. I'm sorry. Go take a nice long vacation. 
[68]You're a smart guy Steve. Everything I said yesterday is true. But maybe politics isn't for you. 
[69]Do yourself a favor. Get out now while you still can. Go into entertainment, or business, or open a fucking restaurant in Costa Rica - anything. Do what will make you happy. You stay in this business long enough it makes you jaded and cynical. 
[70]Yeah. Just like me. 
[71]I didn't know. I thought you might, but I didn't know. 
[72]Thing you gotta know about Paul- he's big on loyalty. 
[73]Put yourself in my shoes Steve. Your opponent has the best media mind in the country working on his team. What do you try to do? You either try to hire him yourself, or work it so if you can't have him, the other team can't either. This was a win-win situation for me. You work for us -great. Paul doesn't have you. Then again, if Paul fires you and I don't take you -fine - Paul still doesn't have you. Either way I win. The moment I got you to sit down in that chair, I knew I'd won. 
[74]It's not easy for me to do this sort of thing Steve. Don't think I take any pleasure in it. I'm sorry for you. I really am. Take care of yourself. 
[75]No it's not decisive, we still have several contests and those states are going to want to have their say. It does look like we'll win Ohio... 
[76]We still have a lot of contests Rachel, Ohio is- 
[77]Of course we have the funds. We're getting new donations daily...
dialogues.IDA:

[10]So Stephen... 
[11]Stephen, Stephen, Stephen.... 
[12]Paul's going to the airport? 
[13]Getting on a plane.

[15]Not going back to headquarters. 
[16]He's not going to Texas? 
[17]What if I said North Carolina? 
[18]He's going to North Carolina. 
[19]I knew it. Now tell me why. 
[20]I hate you. 
[21]I love Paul. You I hate. 
[22]Sexual favors? 
[23]If it meant a good scoop my fiance would understand. 
[24]You really buy into all this crap? All this take back the country nonsense? 
[25]You really have drunk the kool-aid. 
[26]Or what? The world will fall apart? It won't matter...Not one bit to the everyday lives of everyday fuckers who work and eat and sleep and get up and go back to work again. If your boy wins...You get a job in the white house...If he loses you're back at a consulting firm on K Street...That's it. You used to know that before you got all goosebumpy about this guy. Morris is a politician...He's a nice guy...They're all nice guys. 13. 
[27]He will let you down...sooner or later. 
[28]What? 
[29]Seriously? 
[30]My lips are sealed. 
[31]He's gonna endorse? 
[32]That's huge. 
[33]He's said publicly he's not gonna endorse anyone. 14. 
[34]So this is for real? 
[35]When are you gonna announce? 
[36]Stevie ... off the record ... 
[37]That's not what I wanted to ask you about. 
[38]You met with Duffy. 
[39]A little bird. 
[40]Did you meet with him? 
[41]I know you met with him at a little bar in Cincy, two nights ago, just before the press conference. Duffy ordered buffalo wings. 
[42]Anonymous. What happened with Duffy? 63. 
[43]Wait wait wait -is that what you thought? That we were friends? 
[44]You're right -you've given me a lot. But let's get real here Steve. The only reason you ever treated me well was that I work for the Times. Not because I was your friend. You give me what I want, I write you better stories. Don't pretend it's any more than that. Why'd you meet with Duffy? 
[45]Okay, I'll make it easier on you. Forget Duffy. What happened at Paul and Thompson's meeting? 
[46]Of course I do. That's why I'm giving you a choice here. 
[47]So it's not a difficult choice, is it? I've got to file by three p.m. 64. 
[48]tomorrow. You've got till then to make up your mind. 
[49]Is suicide ruled out? 
[50]Will you continue with your schedule today? You're set to tour Proctor & Gamble this afternoon. 86. 
[51]You're making me look bad. 
[52]I just filed a story that said you were off the campaign and Thompson was going to Pullman. 
[53]I want to give you an opportunity to comment on my next story. It says that you delivered Thompson...You got the three hundred and fifty-six delegates, you delivered the nomination. And all you asked in return was Paul's job. Any chance of you confirming that? 
[54]Come on Stephen...aren't we friends anymore?

[21]Listen to this. I got the placement in the Times...this is a match up of hope versus fear. Nine times out of ten the fear candidate tends to be the most experienced...but in our presidential races the least experienced candidate almost always wins. JFK versus Nixon...Carter versus Ford...Bush versus Gore...I like our chances with the new kid on the block, end quote. Thomas Fucking Duffy...he's gotta be having a stroke right now.

I just jumped three years ahead...so starting tomorrow morning we go into full damage control and I'm telling you Stephen's going ape shit...he said he's taking everyone down on his way out...Morris, everybody! 
[26]Shit I gotta take this. Do you need anything? 
[27]Stephen, it's Ben...listen ...what the fuck...did Paul lose his mind?...Jesus...what're you gonna do? Call me.

[29]Are you a Bearcat?

dialogues.SENATOR THOMPSON:
[1]That's what I'm hearing...since Super Tuesday I'm a very popular guy. What are your polls telling you? 
[2]And so you think they won't for your guy...you think Morris gets into the independents? 
[3]Estella...hand me that ice bucket. 
[4]I want on the ticket...you need me on the ticket...and you need my delegates...you could use em before Tuesday. Make a fine story on the Sunday morning news cycle...so I expect to hear from you by noon tomorrow...or I endorse Pullman and take my cabinet seat. 
[5]Anything else you want to talk about? 
[6]And the right man to lead this great nation of ours in these challenging times and the next President of the United States of America, Governor Mike Morris!...And I ask only one thing, that all of us stand shoulder to shoulder and arm in arm in a united Democratic party. 
[7]And I strongly urge that the three hundred and fifty-six loyal delegates that I have carried as a badge of honor, throw their support to the Governor. Let's end this primary and get on to the business of 1600 Pennsylvania Ave! 
[8]Thank you. And God bless the United States of America.

dialogues.RACHEL MADDOW:
[1]Well it all comes down to this...We are one week away from the Ohio primary... 
[2]Two democrats are left standing. Senator Pullman of Arkansas who is trailing Governor Morris from Pennsylvania. 
[3]Governor Morris has mounted a sizable lead with 2047 delegates, winning New Hampshire, California, New York and Michigan...But Senator Pullman with 1302 delegates is still in the hunt having won Florida, Tennessee, Virginia and Missouri... 
[4]A win in Ohio could turn it all around for the Arkansas Senator... 
[5]And once again the old adage is true..."As goes Ohio, so goes the Nation." 
[6]But you must concede that these three hundred and fifty-six delegates put the pledged delegates out of reach. And with word today that the super delegates are breaking three to one for Morris. 
[7]Well then do you have the funds? As we read it-
